snippet: A revised system, based on hurricane storm-surge data, includes more zones and covers 37 percent of all New York City residences.
abstract: Bloomberg administration releases map of expanded hurricane evacuation zones using six zone categories instead of three, placing 600,000 more people within evacuation boundaries; map also adds 26 Housing Authority developments, four hospitals and nine nursing homes.
lead_paragraph: A revised system, based on hurricane storm-surge data, includes more zones and covers 37 percent of all New York City residences.

headline.main: City Adds 600,000 People to Storm Evacuation Zones
headline.print_headline: City Adds 600,000 People To Storm Evacuation Zones
